verses.text: 神在何烈山上與以色列人立約摩西把以色列人都召了來，對他們說：「以色列人哪，我今日講給你們聽的律例和典章，你們要聽從，要學習，要謹慎遵行。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
More formal than 今天 (jīntiān).
Often used in formal or religious contexts.

verses.text: 耶和華我們的 神在何烈山與我們立了約。

words.note: Often preceded by a space in CUNPSS to indicate reverence for the Lord.

verses.text: 這約，耶和華不是與我們的列祖立的，而是與我們今日在這裡還活著的人立的。
耶和華在山上，從火中，面對面的與你們說話。
那時，我站在耶和華和你們中間，要把耶和華的話告訴你們；你們因為懼怕那火，所以沒有上到山上來，耶和華說：
重述十誡「『我是耶和華你的 神，曾經把你從埃及地，從為奴之家領出來。

words.note: Refers to the one true God, often elevated in Bible text.

verses.text: 「『除我以外，你不可有別的神。
「『你不可為自己做偶像，也不可做天上、地下和地底下水中各物的形象。

words.definition: all kinds of things, every creature

verses.text: 不可跪拜它們，也不可事奉它們，因為我耶和華你們的 神是忌邪的 神；恨惡我的，我必追討他們的罪，從父親到兒子，直到三四代。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for serving deities or superiors.
Refers to the one true God, often elevated in Bible text.
Biblical concept of God's jealousy for exclusive worship, intolerant of rivals.
Refers to the one true God, often elevated in Bible text.
Turns the preceding phrase into 'those who...'

verses.text: 愛我和遵守我誡命的，我必向他們施慈愛，直到千代。

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into 'those who...'

verses.text: 「『不可妄稱耶和華你 神的名，因為妄稱耶和華的名的，耶和華必不以他為無罪。

words.note: Specifically refers to irreverent use of a name.
In many Chinese Bibles, a raised space precedes 神 (God) as a mark of reverence.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause, e.g., 'one who...'
Lit. 'without sin'.

verses.text: 「『要遵守安息日為聖日，照著耶和華你 神吩咐你的。

words.note: Lit. 'peace-rest day'.
In many Chinese Bibles, a raised space precedes 神 (God) as a mark of reverence.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun, meaning 'what was commanded to you'.

verses.text: 六日要勞碌，作你一切工作。
但第七日是屬於耶和華你 神的安息日；這一日，你和你的兒女、僕婢、牛驢和一切牲畜，以及你城裡的寄居者，不可作任何的工，好使你的僕婢可以和你一樣享受安息。

words.note: In many Chinese Bibles, a raised space precedes 神 (God) as a mark of reverence.
A compound term for household servants.
Often used to represent all draft animals or livestock generally.
Locative suffix often appended to nouns to indicate 'inside'.
Refers to a foreigner residing in a land.

verses.text: 你要記住：你在埃及地作過奴僕；耶和華你的 神用大能的手和伸出來的膀臂，把你從那裡領出來，因此耶和華你的 神吩咐你要守安息日。

words.note: In many Chinese Bibles, a raised space precedes 神 (God) as a mark of reverence.
Verb-complement construction indicating direction/result.
A poetic or formal term for 'arm', often representing strength.
Marks the following noun as the direct object of the verb.
Verb-complement construction indicating direction/result.
In many Chinese Bibles, a raised space precedes 神 (God) as a mark of reverence.

verses.text: 「『要孝敬父母，照著耶和華你的 神吩咐你的，使你可以得享長壽，也使你在耶和華你的 神賜給你的地上，得享福樂。

words.note: To show filial piety and respect.
The preceding space is a common biblical stylistic choice to emphasize deity.
Literally 'obtain enjoyment', often used in formal or religious contexts.
The preceding space is a common biblical stylistic choice to emphasize deity.
Implies a grant from a superior to an inferior.
Literally 'obtain enjoyment', often used in formal or religious contexts.
Refers to both happiness and divine blessing.

verses.text: 「『不可殺人。

words.note: Indicates prohibition or strong advice against something.
A verb-object compound specifically meaning 'to kill a person'.

verses.text: 「『不可姦淫。

words.note: Indicates prohibition or strong advice against something.
Refers to sexual immorality outside of marriage.

verses.text: 「『不可偷盜。

words.note: Indicates prohibition or strong advice against something.
A more formal or comprehensive term for stealing.

verses.text: 「『不可作假證供陷害你的鄰舍。

words.note: Indicates prohibition or strong advice against something.
Refers to a statement or evidence given, often in a legal context.
To conspire against someone, often by fabricating evidence.
A more formal or biblical term for 'neighbor' than 鄰居 (línjū).

verses.text: 「『不可貪愛你鄰舍的妻子；不可貪圖你鄰舍的房屋、田地、僕婢、牛驢和你鄰舍的任何東西。』

words.note: Specifically refers to unlawful desire in commandments.
More formal than 鄰居, common in biblical texts.
A traditional term for household servants, common in older texts.
Refers to common livestock in ancient times.
Etymologically from things found in markets to the east and west.

verses.text: 人民懼怕，摩西作中保「這些話就是耶和華在山上，從火中、密雲中、幽暗裡，大聲對你們全體會眾所說的，並沒有加添甚麼；他把這些話寫在兩塊石版上，交給了我。

words.note: Often used in the Bible to describe fear of God.
A key theological term for a go-between, especially Christ.
Short for 出埃及記 (Book of Exodus).
Often carries a sense of mystery or foreboding in biblical contexts.
Specific term for a religious gathering.
Often used to emphasize a negation or statement.

words.definition: did not have, there was no
to hand over to, entrust to

verses.text: 那時山上被火燒著，你們聽見有聲音從黑暗中發出來的時候，你們各支派的首領和你們的長老，都走到我這裡來，

words.note: Commonly used for the tribes of Israel.
Refers to a respected leader or official, particularly in religious contexts.

words.definition: to walk to, arrive by walking

verses.text: 說：『看哪，耶和華我們的 神把他的榮耀和偉大顯給我們看，我們又聽見他從火中發出來的聲音；今日我們看見了 神與人說話，而人還能活著。

words.note: An exclamation common in biblical narration.
Often used to describe divine majesty or praise.
When referring to God, it signifies supreme power and majesty.
More formal or literary than 今天 (jīntiān).

verses.text: 現在這大火快要吞滅我們了，我們為甚麼要冒死呢？如果我們再聽見耶和華我們 神的聲音，我們就必死亡。

words.note: Often used in the Bible for consuming destruction or judgment.
Implies strong certainty, often divine will or consequence in religious texts.
Often carries spiritual significance in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 因為有血肉生命的人，有誰像我們一樣，聽見永活的 神從火中說話的聲音，還能活著呢？

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to describe human mortality.
The space before 神 is a common stylistic choice in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.

verses.text: 現在求你走前去，聽聽耶和華我們的 神要說的一切話；然後你要把耶和華我們的 神對你所說的一切話，都告訴我們；我們就必聽從，也必遵行。』

words.note: Reduplication of verb indicates a short or casual action, or carefulness.
The Hebrew name for God.
The space before 神 is a common stylistic choice in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Often used with a verb to form a noun phrase or emphasize the object of an action.

verses.text: 「你們對我說話的時候，耶和華聽見了你們說話的聲音；耶和華就對我說：『這人民對你所說的話，我都聽見了；他們所說的都很好。

words.note: Often used with a verb to form a noun phrase or emphasize the object of an action.
Often used with a verb to form a noun phrase or emphasize the object of an action.

verses.text: 但願他們常常存著這樣的心，敬畏我，遵守我的一切誡命，使他們和他們的子孫永享福樂。

words.note: A key concept in Abrahamic religions, combining respect and fear.

verses.text: 你去對他們說：「你們回到自己的帳棚裡去吧。」

words.note: Frequently refers to nomadic tents in biblical contexts.
Often used as a locative suffix.
Here indicates going away from the speaker.

verses.text: 至於你，你要站在我這裡；我要把一切誡命、律例、典章，都告訴你；你要教導他們，使他們在我賜給他們作產業的地上遵行。』

words.note: Refers to divine commands or statutes.
Often paired with 'commandments' in biblical context.
Refers to legal or religious regulations.
Formal word for 'give', common in religious texts.
Often refers to an inherited portion or heritage.
Implies both following and doing.

verses.text: 所以，你們要照著耶和華你們的 神吩咐你們的，謹守遵行，不可偏離左右。

words.note: Transliteration of the divine name.
The space before 神 is a common reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Emphasizes careful observance.
Implies both following and doing.
Figuratively means 'in any direction'.

verses.text: 你們要走在耶和華你們的 神吩咐你們走的路上，使你們可以活著，可以享福，並且使你在將要佔領為業的地上，可以長久居住。」

words.note: Transliteration of the divine name.
The space before 神 is a common reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
To receive and benefit from blessings.
Short for 產業, referring to an inherited portion.
